addressleaf.section:
3 Au
g
1594 Copy of my L. l
re
to M
r
Bodely.

page.lettertext:
fol.79r
S
r
, upon the first daie of this moneth at one instance I received
three l
re
s from yow, 2 of the xxj
th
of the last moneth, & the iij
th
of the xxviij
th
; by both the former it appeareth, that upon the receit
of my l
re
s of the vij
th
of July declaring hir
Ma
ties
purpose to
reskue
Brest,
& request to have their assistaunce by Sea, yow had
Conference w
t
the
States
about the same; in whom yow found
good disposition to assist hir Ma
tie
in that Enterprise w
t
nyne, or
tenne shippes: But yet bycause yow were not able to declare
unto them the particularities of hir Ma
ties
resoluc
o
n for the time, &
the Rendez vous, neither w
th
the number of hir Ma
ties
shippes,
Soldiers, munic
o
n, & powder they could not make present
determinac
o
n w
th
yow, & yet nevertheles it appeareth by yo
r
second l
re
, that
M
r
Caron
had advertised the States perticularly
of hir Ma
ties
purpose, as the same was determined in my
howse the xv
th
of the last moneth: and Conferring w
t
yow
thereupon yow alledged that yow had not understood the
ticular
pointes thereof, & so it seemeth by yo
r
writing, that for lack
of yo
r
informac
o
n the matter was at a staie, although it
might appeare well unto yow by their owne report, that hir
Ma
ties
demaund was to have nyne, or tenne shippes for tenne
monethes, wherein they fownd no difficultie to yeld unto the Q.
nor to the provision of 20000
wzt
of powder; and yet they
Could not well Conceave, what was ment by a request of
two moneths victualles for 2000 men: they also seemed to
find lack in that there was no menc
o
n made of munic
o
n
nor of greate quantitie of powder for the recoverie of the
Fort of Brest; And by yo
r
l
re
of the xxviij
th
it seemeth
that upon a l
re
written by M
sr
de Caron unto them the verie
xv
th
daie of July, that he was Countermaunded the same
daie; By all w
ch
uncertaintie it hath fallen out verie
unluckely, that these preparac
o
ns of the States have hong in
suspence, & cannot be executed so soone, as the time requireth.
But for cleering of all these former scruples, yow shall under-
tand that the verie xv
th
of July, M
sr
Caron was directed
not onelie, what to demaund of the States, but at what
time the same was required, & what were the forces then
determined by hir Ma
tie
. And though it was trew, that
the same
fol.79v
the same daie he was written to by my sonne, upon theQ.
Commaundem
t
, that he should staie the sending awaie of his l
re
s
for the present untyll he might be newlie spoken w
th
all; w
ch
was ment to be the next daie, & having receaved that Counter-
maund, he made answere presentlie that he had alreadie sent
away his l
re
s to the States agreable to the motions made to him
the said xv
th
; wherew
th
hir Ma
tie
being made acquainted, she
was verie well satisfyed, & allowed of his diligence; & so untyll
the verie time of the receit of these yo
r
latter l
re
s we were in
opinion, & expectation to have [had] of these assistances of the
States shippes, & other their provisions to have bin at
Portesmouth
before the fifth of this present moneth. And now to explaine
the demaund
as they were made, It is true there were demaunded
xij shippes at the least, & victuall
for 2000 men, that might
serve by land for two monethes, & as I think but 20000
wz
t
of powder w
th
out any word
of munic
o
n; But now to
reduce o
r
demaund
to more Certaintie hir Ma
tie
can be Contented
w
th
tenne shippes, if otherwise, the States should not yeld to xij
and for the victuall
considering that w
ch
is alledged by yow of
the dearth of victuall
there, & the cheapnes here, that demaund
may be forborne, although at this p
nt
by the unseasonablenes of
the yeare, I think the dearth of victuall
is more here then
there, Considering the provision of Corne, that readelie is to be
had out of the East Countryes into those./ As for the small
quantitie of powder demaunded, I thinke the same was mistaken
in writing, for indeed 20000
wz
t
of powder is litle more,
then 8 last
, so as it is now rather required to have 60000
wz
t
, w
ch
is not xxx
ty
last
; and yet if xxx
tie
last
may
be had, it shall well Content hir Ma
ty
, and so I hope they
will yeld thereunto, & if it shalbe more, it shalbe the more
thankfull./ At this time wee have had speech w
th
M
sr
Caron
declaring to him the uncertainties gathered by yo
r
letter, whereunto
for o
r
better satisfacc
o
n he sheweth us l
re
s written to him from the
Hagh the 29 of July, whereby in expresse word
they write
that they are readie to send awaie their assistaunce, making no
menc
o
n of any dowbt, or delaie therein; and yet nevertheles he
is directed to write back againe thither w
th
all speed to hasten the
same, by whom I do send these my l
re
s to yow at this time.
From
the Court this iij
th
of August
1594
.
Yo
r
verie loving frend W. B.
We are certainly adv
r
tised,
at
Laon
is rendred
to
e
K
, &
e DD de Mayne, &
D'Aumale
, are
chased out of
Amyens
./
